meanings.definition: To dissect or analyze in detail.
meanings.sent1: The scientist decided to anatomize the frog to learn more about its organs.
meanings.sent2: The biology students will anatomize a flower to understand its different parts.
meanings.sent3: The curious child wanted to anatomize their broken toy to see how it worked.
meanings.sent4: She could anatomize a complex issue like peeling an onion, layer by layer.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to anatomize the crime scene to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: To examine or study the structure of something.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist will anatomize the ancient ruins to uncover their secrets.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often anatomize X-rays to identify any fractures or injuries.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to anatomize the recipe to understand its ingredients better.
meanings.sent4: She could anatomize a poem, breaking down its verses to find deeper meanings.
meanings.sent5: The engineer had to anatomize the blueprint to ensure the building's stability.
